security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only informational content about Polymarket API endpoints and WebSocket data streaming. No scripts, file access, network calls, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Polymarket is the world's largest prediction market platform. This skill provides complete documentation for building applications with their REST API, trading endpoints, and real-time WebSocket data streaming for live market data.
actual_capabilities: Access Polymarket REST API documentation for markets, events, and trading
Understand WebSocket real-time data streaming for live market updates
Implement trading strategies using CLOB (Central Limit Order Book) API
Fetch market data, prices, order books, and user positions
Integrate crypto price feeds from Binance and Chainlink oracles
Build monitoring tools for trades, orders, and market comments
limitations: Does not execute trades - only provides API documentation
Requires separate API key for authenticated endpoints
Rate limits apply based on Polymarket API policies
Must use external TypeScript/Python clients for actual implementation

best_practices: Implement proper error handling for API rate limit responses (429 status)
Use WebSocket subscriptions instead of polling for real-time data
Validate message payloads before processing in production applications
Subscribe to specific markets only rather than using wildcard subscriptions
anti_patterns: Polling the API continuously without respecting rate limits
Storing API credentials in client-side code or version control
Processing all market subscriptions without applying filters
Ignoring connection errors and not implementing reconnection logic

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Polymarket provides official TypeScript and Python clients. The REST API can be accessed from any HTTP client.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for the API?
faq.answer: Rate limits vary by endpoint. General limits are 5000 requests per 10 seconds. See the full rate limit documentation for details.

faq.question: How do I get started with trading API access?
faq.answer: Create API keys through the Polymarket developer portal. Requires L1 and L2 authentication headers for trading endpoints.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only provides documentation. Your API credentials and trading activity remain secure on your local system.

faq.question: Why am I getting rate limit errors?
faq.answer: You may be sending too many requests. Implement exponential backoff and consider using WebSocket subscriptions for real-time data.

faq.question: How does this compare to other prediction market APIs?
faq.answer: Polymarket offers free trading with no platform fees, real-time WebSocket data, and access to the largest prediction market volume.
